isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - TEST INJECTION NOZZLES DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - Injection Nozzle Installation:

step1.para: Thoroughly clean nozzle bore in cylinder head before reinserting nozzle holder assembly. Pay particular attention to seating surfaces, in order that no small particles or carbon will cause assembly to be cocked or permit blow-by of combustion gases. Don't use hard or sharp tools for cleaning. A round piece of brass properly shaped or a round steel bristle brush is permitted if used with care.
Install nozzle assemblies with copper gasket, carefully held in place with a dab of grease, into its bore.

note.para: Make sure old nozzle gasket is not left in bore.

step1.para: Tighten the nozzle crab bolts to 20 lbf-ft.(27N.m).
Reconnect the fuel supply and return lines to the nozzles. Tighten the fuel supply line fittings to 30 lbf-ft. (41 N.m).
Operate engine and check for fuel or combustion gas leakage.
